title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 210.10 - Preliminary conference
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 210.10 - Preliminary conference

State Regulations

In all actions assigned to a judge where
disclosure has not been completed, the court may order a preliminary conference
as soon as practicable after the action has been assigned. The matters to be
considered at the preliminary conference may include simplification and
limitation of factual and legal issues, establishment of a timetable for the
completion of all disclosure proceedings, the addition of other necessary
parties and settlement of the action. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
210.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
